result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M Majewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*Defendant may never live with the victim as long as the child is with the victim.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Complete CGIP.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott M Majewski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott M Majewski in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Scott M Majewski in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
.
Per negotiations at the time of the plea, Court amended Count 2 to include the Domestic Abuse enhancer, Contrary to Wis. Stats 968.075(1)(a).
.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 13 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete CGIP.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may never live with the victim as long as the child is with the victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Scott M Majewski in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Scott M Majewski in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Scott M Majewski not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/14/15 in Branch 40.  State will hold the offer open until 10/09/15.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Scott M Majewski not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Scott M Majewski not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Rosenthal has just been appointed and has not been able to speak with the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Scott M Majewski not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM032849  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/08/2015

Court orders defendant to maintain  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Monique S; IS ( juvenile) and their residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Scott M Majewski in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Scott M Majewski in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
